newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Oct 31.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Oct 31.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

Lion Nathan Ltd reported a NZ$150.4 million net profit for the year to August 31 earlier on Thursday, down from NZ$202.3 million the previous year. But a A$74.2 million tax charge was a big factor and earnings from operations rose 8.1 percent to NZ$246.6 million. Lion Nathan also said its Australian operating earnings fell 2.8 percent to A$243.4 million, while market share fell to 42.0 percent from 43.4 percent last year.

CanWest Global Communications Corp said on Wednesday its unit agreed with New Zealand-based Westpac Communications Ltd to acquire Westpac's 50 percent equity interest in New Zealand's TV3 network for NZ$78.8 million, payable on September 2, 1997. Westpac Communications is a subsidiary of Westpac Banking Corp.
Discovery said Premier Oil Plc had increased its takeover offer for Discovery to 80 cents per share from 70 cents.
Annual meetings are being held today for the above companies.

U.S. high-yield investors showed little interest in a $150 million 144a private placement offering of high-yield zero coupon bonds by Australis Media Ltd which hit the market on Tuesday, market sources said in New York overnight. Accordingly, underwriters Salomon Brothers Inc and Toronto Dominion (USA) Inc were forced to buy a significant portion of the deal themselves, the sources added.
Cumnock Coal Ltd said on Wednesday that chairman and managing director Tom Johnson had resigned. His replacement was not named.

Drug development firm Peptide Technology Ltd said on Wednesday it had revived plans to achieve a London Stock Exchange listing by early March 1997, accompanied by a 10 million pounds sterling capital raising. Peptide executive director operations, Darryl Mellish, also told Reuters the company was due to report another loss for the 1995/96 year ended September 30.
